column1: He was a very selfish Giant.The poor children had now nowhere to play. They tried to play on the road
column2: but the road was very dusty and full of hard stones
column3: and they did not like it. They used to wander round the high wall when their lessons were over
column4: and talk about the beautiful garden inside. "How happy we were there
column5: they said to each other.Then the Spring came, and all over the country there were little blossoms and little birds. Only in the garden of the Selfish Giant it was still winter. The birds did not care to sing in it as there were no children, and the trees forgot to blossom. Once a beautiful flower put its head out from the grass, but when it saw the notice-board it was so sorry for the children that it slipped back into the ground again, and went off to sleep. The only people who were pleased were the Snow and the Frost. Spring has forgotten this garden
column6: they cried, so we will live here all the year round." The Snow covered up the grass with her great white cloak
column7: and the Frost painted all the trees silver.
